Articles.Content: How do I get those big images that people have in their posts? I'm doing a challenge and I want to have my images visible on the OP.

Make the big images, and then post it on a site called imgur. Then, you hit the copy button for BBcode, and then you paste the image where you want it to be.

- - - Updated - - -

Oh, and try GIMP for making them.

> 
> Make the big images, and then post it on a site called imgur. Then, you hit the copy button for BBcode, and then you paste the image where you want it to be.

How do I do it though?

Your talking about screenshots right?

Take screenshots, locate screenshots, go to [www.imgur.com](www.imgur.com) and make an account, upload the pictures, copy the "BB code" link, paste to forums.

Hope that helped. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Take a screenshot by pressing F1.

Screenshots can be found in KspFolder/Screenshots.

Upload to [imgur.com](http://imgur.com/).

On the right, copy the text under "BBCode (message boards & forums)".

Insert into post, should look something like [noparse]![xVpV9vo.png](http://i.imgur.com/xVpV9vo.png)[/noparse].

Profit!

Here's an example of the code for embedding images.

[noparse]![www.image.jpg](www.image.jpg)[/noparse]

[noparse]

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/glleRYcoDe)

[/noparse]
ie, this bit of the imgur address "https://imgur.com/gallery/**ZQE2a**#0"
